bibl.title: The Meaning of Dates on Mummy Labels: Seasonal Mortality and Mortuary Practice in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: Argues that unspecified chronological references on mummy labels record the formal completion of mummification some 70 days after death.
bibl.seg: SCHEIDEL Walter, The Meaning of Dates on Mummy Labels: Seasonal Mortality and Mortuary Practice in Roman Egypt.
Argues that unspecified chronological references on mummy labels record the formal completion of mummification some 70 days after death.
